Comments_List: I developed skills in running behavioral experiments in rats with pharmacological manipulations, doing statistical analyses on the resultant data, and was introduced to wet lab methods.
Independent research in select topic within Cognitive Science.
I was able to gain familiarity with research in a lab setting, including how to design and conduct experiments and write up reports summarizing what I had learned/accomplished.
Better understanding of experimental design/intellectually stimulating conversations
How to take responsibility of projects and deal with assignments.

A strength of this course is the flexibility it offers. There is no weekly time requirement, and as long as you can make a case that your research is intellectually rigorous, you'll be allowed to pursue it for directed research. I can't think of any weaknesses.
Very helpful in learning about infant psychology. Not very interesting sometimes.
Yes, if you currently work in a lab and are a large part of a project within that lab.

Definitely! It allows you to pursue research that you're passionate about while getting course credit for it. And the "extra" requirements of this course aren't muchjust an assignment/report/presentation at midterm and at the end of the semester.
Of course! Working with Dr. Knobe is super awesome.
